{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3150205,"name":"Connor Braden","username":"Texas0803","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/texas0803/{size}/203328_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-21T23:59:34.156Z","cooked":"

Hello! My team has been having trouble with REV Robotic’s ION system’s MAXSpline Shaft. We are following their 2023 ION Starterbot, which uses a MAXSpline Shaft pushed through a MAXSpline bracket and a 2x1 MAXSpline MAXTube. We‘ve found that the shaft’s profile is slightly larger than the profile of the bracket and the MAXTube. Part of our build team ate up an hour-and-a-half meeting just trying to file down and lubricate the shaft and the holes. It seems to us that this is a clearance issue that may not apply to every MAXSpline shaft. Are any other teams having this problem? If not, how are ya’ll getting these inserted?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-02-22T00:01:07.292Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":147,"reads":298,"readers_count":297,"score":799.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":427656,"topic_slug":"difficulty-inserting-maxspline-shaft-into-maxspline-holes","display_username":"Connor Braden","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54036,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7691 TSA All Stars"},"post_url":"/t/difficulty-inserting-maxspline-shaft-into-maxspline-holes/427656/1","custom_user_title":"7691 TSA All Stars","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3150231,"name":"Christopher149","username":"Christopher149","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/838e76/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-22T00:58:29.108Z","cooked":"
Texas0803:

Are any other teams having this problem? If not, how are ya’ll getting these inserted?

We’ve had some of the same difficulty, addressed with filling and a mallet.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-02-22T00:58:29.108Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":288,"readers_count":287,"score":82.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":427656,"topic_slug":"difficulty-inserting-maxspline-shaft-into-maxspline-holes","display_username":"Christopher149","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14984,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC857 lead mentor / FTC10723+13284+15270 lead mentor"},"post_url":"/t/difficulty-inserting-maxspline-shaft-into-maxspline-holes/427656/2","custom_user_title":"FRC857 lead mentor / FTC10723+13284+15270 lead mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3150330,"name":"Jon Stratis","username":"Jon_Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-22T03:46:44.591Z","cooked":"

We didn’t buy the MAXTube with the spline pattern, but did CNC some spline holes in tubes. We found that we needed to take off an extra 0.008” on the holes for a nice fit, but otherwise didn’t have a problem getting it to fit. I wonder what the tollerances are between the spline and the tube/plates.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-02-22T03:46:44.591Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":267,"readers_count":266,"score":73.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":427656,"topic_slug":"difficulty-inserting-maxspline-shaft-into-maxspline-holes","display_username":"Jon Stratis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7968,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC"},"post_url":"/t/difficulty-inserting-maxspline-shaft-into-maxspline-holes/427656/3","custom_user_title":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3150341,"name":"REV Robotics Co-founder & CEO","username":"Greg_Needel","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/greg_needel/{size}/244586_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-22T03:54:34.752Z","cooked":"

It shouldn’t require that much effort. It is a very tight fit, but if you are needing to spend hours getting it in, there is likely a burr somewhere that is preventing it going in. Taking a file to the hole for a bit, you should be able to just use a mallet to get it to go in. Please feel free to reach out to support@revrobotics.com if you need additional help.

As a side note one of my new favorite tools are flexible hones, They come in many sizes and help deburr and take just a bit off things for easier fits. One of them that is 1.375 and 1.125 are good things to have around the shop and you can get them on https://www.amazon.com/Research-FLEX-HONE-Cylinder-Abrasive-Diameter/dp/B002XUL0EU

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-02-22T03:54:53.687Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":256,"readers_count":255,"score":111.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":427656,"topic_slug":"difficulty-inserting-maxspline-shaft-into-maxspline-holes","display_username":"REV Robotics Co-founder & CEO","primary_group_name":"REV","flair_name":"REV","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/d/b/db93216ec14c273ae2ca04aa396186c0461d0620.png","flair_bg_color":"F05A28","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":55,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.amazon.com/Research-FLEX-HONE-Cylinder-Abrasive-Diameter/dp/B002XUL0EU","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":95}],"read":true,"user_title":"REV Robotics","title_is_group":false,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":511,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/difficulty-inserting-maxspline-shaft-into-maxspline-holes/427656/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3150342,"name":"Richard Wallace","username":"Richard_Wallace","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/richard_wallace/{size}/110760_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-22T03:56:38.600Z","cooked":"

Do you have a gauge for the holes you cut? How do you know that an extra .008 inch was required?

Or does your comment above only mean you added .008 inch to a program?

Back to the OP: in an earlier post I talked about using a pittypat hammer. It is my favorite tool.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-02-22T03:57:30.038Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":238,"readers_count":237,"score":57.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":427656,"topic_slug":"difficulty-inserting-maxspline-shaft-into-maxspline-holes","display_username":"Richard Wallace","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":7968,"username":"Jon_Stratis","name":"Jon Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1549,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I live for the details."},"post_url":"/t/difficulty-inserting-maxspline-shaft-into-maxspline-holes/427656/5","custom_user_title":"I live for the details.","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3150448,"name":"Jon Stratis","username":"Jon_Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-22T12:21:09.036Z","cooked":"

We did a couple of test holes. Cutting the precise pattern of the spline (extruding the spline CAD onto the tube as a hole) was too tight - we couldn’t get the tube in. Adding 0.008” to the cut (fusion360, setting Stock To Leave to -0.008in) gave us a nice fit - note this means 0.008” all the way around, so the diameter was actually 0.016” larger. With a little more testing we might be able to bring that down a little, but we’ll leave that optimization for the off season when we have more time

Greg_Needel:

As a side note one of my new favorite tools are flexible hones, They come in many sizes and help deburr and take just a bit off things for easier fits. One of them that is 1.375 and 1.125 are good things to have around the shop and you can get them on https://www.amazon.com/Research-FLEX-HONE-Cylinder-Abrasive-Diameter/dp/B002XUL0EU

I have been buying the 120

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-02-22T14:14:12.848Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":185,"readers_count":184,"score":47.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":427656,"topic_slug":"difficulty-inserting-maxspline-shaft-into-maxspline-holes","display_username":"REV Robotics Co-founder & CEO","primary_group_name":"REV","flair_name":"REV","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/d/b/db93216ec14c273ae2ca04aa396186c0461d0620.png","flair_bg_color":"F05A28","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":55,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"REV Robotics","title_is_group":false,"reply_to_user":{"id":7968,"username":"Jon_Stratis","name":"Jon Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":511,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/difficulty-inserting-maxspline-shaft-into-maxspline-holes/427656/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3150766,"name":"ToddF","username":"ToddF","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/toddf/{size}/5508_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-22T21:09:15.027Z","cooked":"
Texas0803:

Are any other teams having this problem? If not, how are ya’ll getting these inserted?

On Sunday we rebuilt our arm changing the base and elbow joints to MAXSpline joints. We used multiple stacked maxspline plates, spacers, and even 3D printed parts on to a single spline tube. We used a deadblow hammer to assemble the joints. They aren’t ever coming apart.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-02-22T21:09:15.027Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":160,"readers_count":159,"score":37.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":427656,"topic_slug":"difficulty-inserting-maxspline-shaft-into-maxspline-holes","display_username":"ToddF","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16376,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/difficulty-inserting-maxspline-shaft-into-maxspline-holes/427656/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3150788,"name":"Nate Laverdure (he/him)","username":"Nate_Laverdure","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nate_laverdure/{size}/134005_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-22T21:46:55.761Z","cooked":"

I originally had some doubts about the need for a new COTS “build system” for FRC, but after this experience, I am jazzed about MAXSpline as a product, and I now feel like I need to dig deeper into the greater ION system because I’m curious to see how it can be leveraged to full effect.

I think it uniquely, neatly, and compactly solves the problem of communicating big shaft torques (and to a lesser degree, bending moments carried by these shafts) across the tens-of-inches distances that are commonly seen on FRC-scale robots.

I haven’t been this happy about a new COTS product since the versakey hub.

Here’s a section cut looking at just the left side of the splined joint I was so happy about. (So we’re looking at just 1 quadrant of a symmetric assembly… you will need to visualize the other 3 quadrants.)

image782×677 39.7 KB

.
Some other things I thought were neat about it:

  • Regular 1-1/4 NPS SCH-40 PVC can be used as a (tight) shaft spacer. We cut one of these pipes lengthwise down the middle, and strapped it onto the spline with cable ties. This provides a quick way to adjust axial spacing of components on the spline.

  • Flanged sleeve bearings that run on the OD (e.g. 2938T64) are commercially available.

  • Shaft collars that clamp on the OD (e.g. 6436K146) are commercially available.

  • Flanged sleeve bearings that run on the ID (e.g. 6338K585) are commercially available. We needed to do a little lathe work to make this fit work. However, the really cool thing about this item is that the flange extends out far enough to help axially retain stuff on the OD of the spline.

  • It all went together with a few swings of a dead-blow hammer.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-02-22T21:56:12.165Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":135,"readers_count":134,"score":97.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":427656,"topic_slug":"difficulty-inserting-maxspline-shaft-into-maxspline-holes","display_username":"Nate Stratis","username":"Jon_Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-22T22:05:16.587Z","cooked":"
Nate_Laverdure:
  • Regular 1-1/4 NPS SCH-40 PVC can be used as a (tight) shaft spacer. We cut one of these pipes lengthwise down the middle, and strapped it onto the spline with cable ties. This provides a quick way to adjust axial spacing of components on the spline.

We did similar - Instead of cutting fully in half, we cut a slit down one side so it still holds together without needing to ziptie it. The slit is enough to let it slip on without any real difficulty! The stackup we ended up with on our spline is pretty neat, too
